page.title: 09Beaches and Chines
page.content: Access to the shingle and sand beach is difficult and usually made down one of the steep cuts in the cliffs called chines.In the Atherfield area there are four;East to West they are{Ladder, {Whale,Shepherd's and Cowleaze.}Ladder Chine is no longer safe because of cliff falls but we visited the beach via Whale Chine.There were 115 steps down to the beach.Inspite of this, this beach was popular with locals and holiday makers who prefer a quiet unspoilt area to the more popular beaches of other areas on the island. Shepherd's Chine and Cowleaze Chine are more accessible but are rather wet underfoot.There is a pumphouse and weir at Shepherd's Chine and sewage works including filterbeds at Cowleaze.Access at any other point is difficult and dangerous.
